text: let's just show you these incredible
pictures that we've had from our
helicopter and these show what is
happening in Calais where lorries are
either stationary or slow-moving and
it's leading to an opportunity for
migrants who have been camped out in
Calais to try to hop on board those
lorries as they attempt to get across
the channel to Britain currently 3,000
migrants in camps in Calais being held
there as they try to cross over from
France to the UK Calais really has
become the focus of attention recently
because the numbers of migrants there
have swelled quite quite considerably in
quite a small period of time more than
3000 now since April and you can see
there on the side of the road they're
walking around very openly looking for
opportunities to get into the back of
lorries no doubt the drivers completely
unaware of what is going on behind them
but this is all being picked up by our
helicopter crew and there you can see
that the traffic which is making its way
slowly to the port the problems there
caused today by that strike action by
French ferry workers
